description: Health plans health care clearinghouses and certain health care providers as defined by HIPAA who directly transmit or use electronic health information in conducting business
primary_responsibilities: Implement HIPAA Privacy Security and Breach Notification Rules; establish policies and procedures for PHI protection; designate privacy and security officers; manage business associates; report breaches; maintain documentation of compliance
authority_source: HIPAA Title II; HITECH Act Title I
compliance_obligations: Direct HIPAA compliance obligations for Privacy Rule Security Rule Breach Notification Rule and HITECH amendments; business associate oversight; individual rights fulfillment
enforcement_authority: HHS OCR - direct penalty authority; State Attorneys General; Department of Justice (for criminal violations)
domains_covered: Breach Notification; Business Associate Oversight; Privacy Protections; Security Safeguards; Risk Assessment; Encryption; Access Controls; Audit Logging; Incident Response; EHR Adoption; Meaningful Use
examples: Hospitals; Health Systems; Physician Practices; Dental Offices; Mental Health Clinics; Insurance Companies; Health Plans

description: Entity that performs functions or activities on behalf of a covered entity or provides services to a covered entity that involve creation receipt maintenance or transmission of electronic protected health information (ePHI)
primary_responsibilities: Comply with HIPAA Privacy and Security Rules as specified in Business Associate Agreements; implement safeguards for ePHI protection; report breaches to covered entities within 60 days; maintain audit logs and records; ensure subcontractor compliance; provide evidence of compliance
authority_source: HIPAA Title II; HITECH Act Subtitle A (Section 13405-13408)
compliance_obligations: Direct HIPAA compliance obligations same as covered entities; must execute Business Associate Agreements; subcontractor management; breach notification; specific safeguard implementation; audit and documentation requirements
enforcement_authority: HHS OCR - direct penalty authority; State Attorneys General; Covered Entity (contractual); Subcontractors flow-down; Department of Justice (for criminal violations)
domains_covered: Breach Notification; Business Associate Compliance; Safeguards Implementation; Risk Assessment; Audit Logging; Encryption; Access Controls; Incident Response; Subcontractor Accountability; Contractual Compliance
examples: Cloud Service Providers; EHR Vendors; Billing Companies; IT Support Firms; Data Centers; Claims Processors; Revenue Cycle Vendors; Consultants; Attorneys; Auditors; Transcription Services

description: Entity engaged by a business associate to create receive maintain or transmit electronic protected health information (ePHI) on behalf of the covered entity or business associate; must comply with same HIPAA and HITECH requirements as business associates
primary_responsibilities: Comply with HIPAA Privacy and Security Rules as specified in subcontractor agreements; implement required safeguards for ePHI protection; report breaches to business associates within 60 days; maintain compliance with documented requirements; cooperate with audits
authority_source: HIPAA Title II; HITECH Act Subtitle A (Section 13423)
compliance_obligations: Direct HIPAA liability same as covered entities and business associates; must execute written agreements with business associates; breach notification within 60 days; safeguard implementation; full compliance obligations
enforcement_authority: HHS OCR - direct penalty authority; Business Associate (contractual); Covered Entity (through flow-down); State Attorneys General; Department of Justice (for criminal violations)
domains_covered: Breach Notification; Safeguards Implementation; Audit Logging; Encryption; Access Controls; Incident Response; Compliance Documentation; Subcontractor Accountability if they engage further vendors
examples: API Developers; Data Backup Services; Hosting Providers; System Integrators; Consultants; Managed Service Providers; Authentication Services; Security Auditors

description: The Office for Civil Rights (OCR) within the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services responsible for enforcing HIPAA Privacy Rule Security Rule Breach Notification Rule and HITECH Act amendments against covered entities and business associates
primary_responsibilities: Investigate HIPAA and HITECH violations from complaints or audits; conduct periodic compliance audits and examinations; assess penalties according to tiered structure; issue enforcement actions including warning letters notices of violation and corrective action plan requirements; provide guidance and technical assistance to entities; maintain list of breaches affecting 500+ individuals
authority_source: HIPAA Enforcement Rule (45 CFR Part 160); HITECH Act Title I Subtitle D
regulatory_scope: Federal United States; authority over all states and territories
compliance_obligations: Statutory authority to investigate and enforce; penalty assessment authority from $100 to $50000 per violation with $1.5M annual cap; authority to subpoena documents and issue subpoenas; audit authority over covered entities and business associates; ability to defer to State Attorneys General; issuing guidance documents and technical assistance
enforcement_authority: Direct enforcement authority; coordinates with State Attorneys General; refers criminal violations to Department of Justice; coordination with other federal agencies including ONC and CMS
domains_covered: Enforcement & Penalties; Breach Notification Investigation; Business Associate Audit; Risk Assessment Verification; Safeguard Audit; Audit Logging Review; Access Control Audit; Encryption Standards; Incident Response Procedures; Corrective Action Plans; Penalty Assessment; Safe Harbor Evaluation
examples: HHS Office of General Counsel; Regional OCR Directors; OCR Investigators

role_name: Office of the National Coordinator for Health Information Technology (ONC)
description: Federal agency within HHS responsible for certifying electronic health record (EHR) systems and establishing EHR certification standards and testing procedures to promote health information exchange and meaningful use of certified systems
primary_responsibilities: Establish and maintain EHR certification standards and requirements; designate authorized testing bodies to conduct EHR system certification testing; maintain authoritative list of certified EHR systems; monitor and update certification standards; coordinate with CMS on Meaningful Use program; provide technical guidance on certified EHR requirements; maintain Office of Health Information Technology policy direction
authority_source: HITECH Act Title I Subtitle B (Section 13412 13420)
compliance_obligations: Authority to establish EHR certification standards; designate testing bodies; maintain certified systems list; update standards and requirements; coordinate with CMS on incentive programs and meaningful use; ONC authority applies to all EHR vendors and systems used in incentive programs
enforcement_authority: Indirect through certification authority and standards setting; no direct penalty authority but works with CMS on incentive program enforcement; can decertify systems for non-compliance
domains_covered: EHR Certification Standards; EHR Testing Standards; Functional Requirements; Security Standards; Privacy Standards; Interoperability Standards; Data Exchange Standards; Certified Systems List Maintenance; Standards Evolution; Coordination with CMS
examples: EHR Vendors; Technology Developers; Testing Bodies; CMS - for incentive program alignment

description: Federal agency within HHS responsible for administering Medicare and Medicaid programs and managing EHR Incentive Payment programs including Meaningful Use and successor programs (Promoting Interoperability MIPS Alternative Payment Models)
primary_responsibilities: Administer EHR incentive payment programs for eligible Medicare and Medicaid providers; establish meaningful use objectives and measures; collect provider attestation for meaningful use achievement; make incentive payments to eligible providers demonstrating meaningful use; establish payment amounts and schedules; monitor provider compliance with meaningful use requirements; transition providers to new payment models; coordinate with ONC on certification standards and testing
authority_source: HITECH Act Title I Subtitle C (Section 13413 13414 13421) and successor legislation (MACRA)
compliance_obligations: Authority to administer incentive programs; set meaningful use objectives and payment amounts; determine provider eligibility; establish payment schedules; require attestation; monitor compliance with meaningful use requirements; authority over Medicare and Medicaid payment programs; ability to recover funds for non-compliance
enforcement_authority: Indirect through payment authority; can withhold or recover payments for non-compliance; coordinates with HHS OCR on privacy and security issues; works with ONC on EHR certification standards
domains_covered: EHR Incentive Programs; Meaningful Use Objectives; Payment Administration; Provider Eligibility; Attestation Requirements; Data Quality Standards; Interoperability Objectives; Payment Schedules; Program Oversight; Fund Recovery
examples: Medicare Providers; Medicaid Providers; Eligible Hospitals; Clinics; Critical Access Hospitals; ONC for standards coordination

description: State-level official responsible for protecting citizens and state residents from HIPAA and HITECH violations affecting them; has authority to pursue civil actions for violations of state law regarding privacy and health information security
primary_responsibilities: Investigate HIPAA and HITECH violations affecting state residents; pursue civil actions against entities for damages; recover actual damages and statutory damages for residents harmed by violations; coordinate with HHS OCR on federal enforcement; provide consumer protection related to health information privacy; enforce state privacy laws that may exceed HIPAA requirements
authority_source: State law authority for health information privacy and civil enforcement; HIPAA Section 1176(b) which allows State AG enforcement; HITECH Act Section 17939 amendment
regulatory_scope: State jurisdiction with responsibility for state residents; can pursue damages for state residents injured by violations
compliance_obligations: Authority to pursue civil actions for HIPAA and HITECH violations affecting state residents; can recover actual damages statutory damages up to $100 per violation court costs and attorney fees; authority to pursue public health and consumer protection actions; can establish settlement agreements with entities
enforcement_authority: Direct civil enforcement authority; coordinates with HHS OCR on federal enforcement; can refer criminal matters to state and federal prosecutors; consumer protection authority
domains_covered: State-Level Enforcement; Civil Damages Recovery; Consumer Protection; Breach Notification Follow-up; Coordination with Federal Enforcement; State Resident Protection
examples: Healthcare Entities Operating in State; Residents of State Injured by Violations

description: Federal agency responsible for prosecuting criminal violations of HIPAA and HITECH Act including knowing violations by individuals or entities that obtain or disclose PHI under false pretenses with intent for commercial advantage or private gain
primary_responsibilities: Prosecute criminal violations of HIPAA referred by HHS OCR or other agencies; represent federal government in criminal proceedings; pursue criminal penalties including fines and imprisonment; investigate criminal conduct related to PHI disclosure or obtaining PHI under false pretenses; coordinate with HHS OCR on criminal referrals
authority_source: HIPAA Section 1307 Criminal Penalties; HITECH Act Section 13410 Criminal Penalties Amendment
compliance_obligations: Authority to prosecute criminal violations; pursue criminal penalties including fines up to $250000 and imprisonment up to 10 years; authority to bring criminal charges for knowing violations; coordinate with law enforcement agencies
enforcement_authority: Exclusive federal criminal prosecution authority; receives referrals from HHS OCR; initiates criminal investigations; coordinates with FBI and other federal law enforcement
domains_covered: Criminal Liability Prosecution; Knowing Violations; False Pretenses; Commercial Advantage; Private Gain; Criminal Penalties; Imprisonment Authority; Fraud Investigation
examples: HHS OCR; FBI; Law Enforcement Agencies

description: Organization that develops designs or manufactures electronic health information systems health information exchange systems personal health record systems or health IT modules subject to HIPAA and HITECH requirements when handling PHI
primary_responsibilities: Design and develop systems meeting HIPAA Security Rule requirements and ONC certification standards if seeking certified status; implement security controls encryption access controls audit logging; comply with HIPAA Breach Notification requirements if business associate; submit systems for ONC certification testing if seeking certified EHR designation; maintain compliance with evolving standards and requirements; support customer compliance efforts
authority_source: HIPAA Title II Privacy and Security Rules; HITECH Act Title I Subtitle B (EHR Certification) and Subtitle A (Safeguards); ONC Certification Standards
regulatory_scope: Federal United States; applies to all developers selling systems used with PHI
compliance_obligations: If acting as business associate must comply with HIPAA Privacy and Security Rules and breach notification; if developing certified EHR must meet ONC standards and certification requirements; subject to HIPAA and HITECH enforcement if handling PHI or acting as BA
enforcement_authority: HHS OCR if acting as business associate; ONC if seeking EHR certification; State Attorneys General; Department of Justice for criminal violations; Covered Entities (contractual)
domains_covered: System Development Compliance; Security Standards; Encryption; Access Controls; Audit Logging; Breach Notification; EHR Certification; Interoperability Standards; Testing and Validation; Customer Support for Compliance
examples: EHR Vendors; PHR Developers; Health Information Exchange Organizations; Health IT Consultants; Software Development Companies; Cloud Providers

description: Healthcare consumer or patient who is the subject of protected health information (PHI) and holds individual rights under HIPAA Privacy Rule and enhanced rights under HITECH Act including right to notification of breaches right to access and amend records and right to request restrictions on uses and disclosures
primary_responsibilities: Exercise individual rights under HIPAA and HITECH including right to receive copy of medical records; right to request amendments; right to request restrictions on uses and disclosures; right to receive notification of breaches; right to request confidential communication; right to receive accounting of disclosures; right to file complaints with HHS OCR or State AGs for violations
authority_source: HIPAA Privacy Rule (45 CFR Parts 164.500-164.528); HITECH Act Section 13410 Accounting of Disclosures; Section 13402 Breach Notification; 42 U.S.C. ยง1177(a)
regulatory_scope: Federal United States; applies to all U.S. healthcare records
compliance_obligations: Right to access and amend PHI; right to notification of breaches of unsecured PHI within 60 days; right to detailed accounting of disclosures for 3 years; right to request restrictions; right to request confidential communication; right to complain to HHS OCR or State AGs for violations
enforcement_authority: Rights holder; can file complaints with HHS OCR or State AGs; can participate in civil litigation for damages; can assert rights in regulatory proceedings
domains_covered: Individual Rights; Breach Notification; Access to Records; Amendment Rights; Restriction Requests; Accounting Rights; Confidential Communication; Complaint Filing Authority; Damages Recovery in Civil Actions

description: Individual designated by covered entity or business associate responsible for developing implementing and maintaining privacy policies and procedures for handling PHI and ensuring compliance with HIPAA Privacy Rule and HITECH Act requirements
primary_responsibilities: Develop and implement privacy policies procedures and safeguards for PHI protection; ensure compliance with HIPAA Privacy Rule minimum necessary standard and use and disclosure restrictions; oversee individual rights fulfillment including access amendments and restriction requests; manage privacy training programs; respond to privacy complaints and breaches; coordinate with security officer; report to organization leadership on privacy compliance status
authority_source: HIPAA Privacy Rule (45 CFR ยง 164.308(a)(2)); HITECH Act amendments requiring enhanced privacy protections
regulatory_scope: Organizational-wide scope within covered entity or business associate
compliance_obligations: Responsibility for implementing and maintaining Privacy Rule compliance; oversight of PHI use and disclosure; individual rights management; documentation of privacy policies and procedures; breach notification coordination; training and awareness programs
enforcement_authority: Reports to organization leadership; subject to HHS OCR audit and enforcement authority; accountable for privacy compliance failures
domains_covered: Privacy Policy Development; Privacy Training; Individual Rights Fulfillment; Breach Investigation; Minimum Necessary Assessment; Risk Assessment; Compliance Monitoring; Breach Notification Coordination
examples: Covered Entities; Business Associates; Healthcare Providers

description: Individual designated by covered entity or business associate responsible for developing implementing and maintaining security policies and procedures for protecting electronic PHI (ePHI) and ensuring compliance with HIPAA Security Rule and HITECH Act security enhancements including risk assessment and encryption requirements
primary_responsibilities: Develop and implement security policies procedures and technical/physical/administrative safeguards for ePHI protection; conduct regular risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and threats; oversee implementation of encryption access controls and audit logging; ensure incident response procedures are in place; manage security training and awareness; coordinate with privacy officer; respond to security breaches and incidents; maintain security documentation
authority_source: HIPAA Security Rule (45 CFR Parts 164.308-164.320); HITECH Act Subtitle A Section 13417 Security Enhancements; Section 13418 Safe Harbor Amendment recognizing NIST standards
regulatory_scope: Organizational-wide scope within covered entity or business associate
compliance_obligations: Responsibility for Security Rule compliance; implementation of required technical physical and administrative safeguards; risk assessment and management; encryption and access control requirements; audit logging and monitoring; incident response; security training and documentation; evidence of recognized security practices for Safe Harbor
enforcement_authority: Reports to organization leadership; subject to HHS OCR audit and enforcement authority; accountable for security compliance failures and breaches resulting from inadequate safeguards
domains_covered: Security Policy Development; Risk Assessment; Encryption Implementation; Access Control Management; Audit Logging; Incident Response; Security Training; Safe Harbor Assessment; Compliance Monitoring; Breach Investigation
examples: Covered Entities; Business Associates; Healthcare Providers

description: Individual or department responsible for ensuring covered entity or business associate compliance with all applicable HIPAA Privacy Rule Security Rule Breach Notification Rule and HITECH Act requirements; coordinates compliance efforts across privacy security and other regulatory areas
primary_responsibilities: Oversee implementation and maintenance of all HIPAA and HITECH compliance activities; coordinate between privacy and security officers; establish compliance monitoring procedures and audit protocols; manage corrective action plans when violations are identified; maintain compliance documentation; respond to regulatory audits and investigations; ensure staff training and awareness; report compliance status to leadership
authority_source: HIPAA Compliance requirements (45 CFR Parts 160 and 164); HITECH Act amendments; HIPAA Rules generally
regulatory_scope: Organizational-wide scope within covered entity or business associate
compliance_obligations: Responsibility for coordinating all HIPAA and HITECH compliance activities; implementation of compliance monitoring and audit procedures; corrective action plan development and implementation; documentation and reporting; staff training and awareness; response to regulatory investigations and enforcement actions
enforcement_authority: Reports to organization leadership and board; subject to HHS OCR audit and enforcement authority; accountable for compliance failures; required to report compliance status to governing body
domains_covered: Compliance Program Development; Monitoring and Auditing; Corrective Action Plans; Training and Awareness; Documentation Management; Regulatory Coordination; Breach Investigation; Risk Assessment
examples: Covered Entities; Business Associates; Healthcare Providers

description: Individual or team within or contracted by covered entity or business associate responsible for conducting internal audits and assessments of HIPAA and HITECH compliance including privacy security and breach notification procedures
primary_responsibilities: Conduct regular internal audits and assessments of Privacy Rule Security Rule and Breach Notification Rule compliance; assess effectiveness of policies procedures and controls; identify compliance gaps and areas for improvement; document audit findings and recommendations; follow up on remediation of identified issues; maintain audit documentation and work papers; provide management with assessment reports
authority_source: HIPAA Audit Standards (45 CFR ยง 164.308(a)(8) Audit Controls); HITECH Act supporting compliance monitoring requirements
regulatory_scope: Organizational-wide scope within covered entity or business associate
compliance_obligations: Responsibility for conducting objective audits and assessments of HIPAA and HITECH compliance; documenting findings; recommending improvements; following up on remediation; maintaining audit documentation; providing management with independent assessment of compliance status
enforcement_authority: Reports to organization leadership (often compliance officer or chief financial officer); subject to HHS OCR review during investigations; audit findings used in OCR penalty assessments
domains_covered: Compliance Auditing; Gap Assessment; Control Evaluation; Remediation Tracking; Documentation Review; Risk Assessment; Regulatory Readiness Assessment
